name: NSMeasurement
desc: An object representing a numeric quantity with a unit of measure, for use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.

items.name: init(doubleValue: Double, unit: Unit)
items.desc: Initializes a new measurement with a specified double-precision floating-point value and unit.

items.name: var doubleValue: Double
items.desc: The measurement value, represented as a double-precision floating-point number.

items.name: func canBeConverted(to: Unit) -> Bool
items.desc: Indicates whether the measurement can be converted to the given unit.

items.name: func converting(to: Unit) -> Measurement<Unit>
items.desc: Returns a measurement created by converting the receiver to the specified unit.

items.name: func adding(Measurement<Unit>) -> Measurement<Unit>
items.desc: Returns a new measurement by adding the receiver to the specified measurement.

items.name: func subtracting(Measurement<Unit>) -> Measurement<Unit>
items.desc: Returns a new measurement by subtracting the specified measurement from the receiver.
